12.post_text: #Ferrari488Pista: the thrill of absolute control. http://bit.ly/Ferrari488Pista_Dynamics

comments.message:
Nice car, but isn't it time to start going electric? I mean, that exhaust sound, it's kind of cool, but it gets old. You can't drive fast without EVERYONE knowing. And does everyone need to know?

Also, the fact that the central point of power comes from "one place" is a negative thing (In my opinion. I could be wrong)

Essentially, it doesn't matter what car, any car with a large engine, behaves like a swing. When you go around a corner, the car SWAYS around the part of the car where the most mass is, the Engine. This is no good for the tyres, and you have to do all sorts of weird things to balance user input with handling.

The Engine (central point of power) is a large, hunk of metal with many moving parts. It's heavy and because it's both Heavy and in one place, the whole dynamic of the car must be tailored around the engine.

If instead you had an electric engine by every wheel (or something similar) you could change the way that the driver controls the car, because the way that the car handles would no longer be centered around the fact that there is a HUGE HEAVY object at one particular point. (the point around which the mass of the whole car, swings) it could be better, perhaps a little more boring though, less drifty.

In an electric car, you would have every wheel turn (AND STEER / brake) independently, depending on it's contact with the surface which the car is driving over. Just saying.
Robert Kovacs Nicu Tarcea Tarlea Cristian
Really bad 3D animation... I have friends tha could do it much better!  FtW are you doing Ferrari???
